jp_name: タケコプター  Take Koputā
description:
The Take-copter is a small yellow colored gadget consisting of horizontally spinning rooters guided by a thin shaft which connects to a wide base. It can easily fit into a normal pocket present in pants or trousers. Sometimes, it consists of a button at the back or on top.
In 1973 anime, the Take-copter had a wider and conical base and the middle part seemed like an antennae.
In 1979 anime and 2005 anime, it had a semi spherical base and was smaller than the 1973 one.
In Stand by Me Doraemon, it had a brown colored suction cap at the base.
Dorami's Take-copter is generally pink colored.
Mini-Doras' Take-copters look exactly same as Doraemon's but they are very small on the basis of size.




The Take-copter is one of the action gadgets of Doraemon. It allows him to fly around. It uses battery, which recharges when not being used. When it's battery runs out, Doraemon descends slowly yet rather uncontrollably. A player may spam the Y button so that Doraemon may get flight and descends further forward. Unlike in the TV shows, Doraemon cannot use other gadgets whilst flying using the Take-copter and neither he can transform into Nobita, but the player can still summon assist other characters.
It is listed under number 32 out of 61 gadgets in the game.
The Take-copter is a gadget which changes all of the dice's surfaces to 6 dots.
The Take-copter also appears in this game.
The Take-copter also appears in this game.
The name "Take-copter" combines the words take tombo (bamboo dragonfly, the Japanese name for bamboo-copter), and herikoputa, meaning helicopter. It was also used to be called "heri-tombo".
Its Japanese name "Take-copter" (タケコプター) is a portmanteau of タケ' [Translation - "Take"] (Bamboo) and コプター [Translation - "Herikoputaa"] (Helicopter).
Its English name "Hopter" is a portmanteau of Hop and Copter.
appears_in: Chapter 21: Time Pistol to Eliminate Obstacle
Chapter 8: A Part Time Job For a Yeti

jp_name: ねがい七夕ロケット Ragaitetaroketto
description:
To use the Tanabata Rocket, the user must use the tags to write the wish that they want, then attach it to the rocket and launch it to the space.
The comparison of the original (left) and the reverse one (right).

jp_name: 技術手袋 Gijutsu Tebukuro
description:
The fingertips of the gloves are capable of turning into a variety of tools, allowing the wearer to modify, reprogram, and upgrade any type of machinery.  
The gloves are red with metallic fingers. The gloves have a grey band around the hand. 
In “Nobita’s Little Space Wars 2021”.

jp_name: てるてる坊主
description: When the user raises the rod, the rain will stop.

jp_name: テルテルコート Teruterukōto
description:
Teru Teru Costume or Teru Teru Coat is a useless gadget that Nobita snatched when Doraemon is about to throw it away.
One wears the costume when it rains, it looks like that the gadget stopped the rain, but it actually sucks all the rain into the costume.

jp_name: 人生やりなおし機 Do-Over Machine
description: The Do-Over Machine can let the user to do-over machine in "that" age that user wants. However, the machine also keep the user's strengh and IQ.

jp_name: General InformationFunctionsDetails
description:
Stand by Me Doraemon 2The Soul Machine is a gadget used in both Doraemon 2005 anime and Stand by Me Doraemon 2.
The gadget has a suction rope that takes your soul into a machine and travels back to the past inside of your mind.

jp_name: タイムベルト Taimu Beruto
description:
It is yellow in color and it looks flexible and has some buttons on it.
Its function is the same as the Time Machine except that it can't change the user's location.
appears_in: Doraemon: Nobita's Great Adventure in the Antarctic Kachi Kochi

jp_name: タイムボート
description:
Time Boat (タイムボート Taimu Bōto) is a specialized time travelling vehicle used by the Time Patrol agents in the Time Patrol Bon franchise.
In the 1989 anime, only type 2 appeared.

jp_name: 時間カメラ Taimu Kamera
description: It can be used to take pictures of things in the past. You must specify how long ago you want the picture to be from, and then click a photo. The camera will show what the object or area was like in the past

jp_name: タイムふろしき, Taimu Furoshiki
description:
The Time Cloth is capable of manipulating time on whatever it covers in a backward or forward direction.
The item does not need to be fully enclosed over its target to function and doesn't necessarily affect its attachments or certain other attributes. In one episode where Doraemon had hung the item over the drying rack, a stray breeze detaches it and the item ends up blinding Nobi Tamako. who tries to navigate around the house with her sight obstructed. Before Doraemon can notice, Tamako was reverted to her younger self (somewhat resembling Shizuka Minamoto), much to her surprise. Notably, even though her body has regressed, her other items did not, and she still retains her memories, resulting in her walking awkwardly in her oversized clothing.
Time Cloth in Anime
appears_in: The Girl With the Red Shoes
God Robot Extends His Hand of Love!
Doraemon: Nobita's Great Adventure into the Underworld

jp_name: タイムマシン
description:
Time Machine is a gadget of 22nd Century which is used to do time travel.
The Time Machine consists of a computer operator and a panel consisting of few handles and switches. It has minimum one seat for the driver to sit. It also consists of an antennae like projection(s) which collects signals.
Doraemon's Time Machine is the most commonly seen and used time machine in the franchise. It consists of a nearly-square-shaped chassis, with various appliances mounting on it, such as controls, antennae, etc. The machine is magnetically powered. It originally has the capacity to hold up to three people at maximum. But since it had broken down once, Doraemon upgraded the gadget, and it is now able to transport up to five people. It is placed in the upper drawer of Nobita's desk in Nobita's room in Nobi's Residence. In the 1973 anime, Doraemon's Time Machine had two seats like a car's interior and two levers. It was fully purple coloured. The antennae didn't exist.
Pawaemon's Time Machine can be seen in Battle! Cat-Model Robots vs. Dog-Model Robots. The overall appearance of his Time Machine remains the same as Doraemon's except it has different colors.
Dorami's Time Machine is more advanced as compared to Doraemon's. It is more spacious and comfortable from inside. It is an orange (sometimes red) tulip-shaped machine with its leaf-like base. Furthermore, it has three antennae like projections at the top which seems to appear like the pistil of a flower. Dorami's time machine is placed in the mirror of her room.
The thief's Time Machine which appeared as A Visitor from the Country of the Future was black coloured, having a pair of yellow and red lights front and back.
Time Patrol's Time Machines resembles like a police car having black and white colour with a small red tail like bulb which glows at the top. They are shaped like a computer mouse. The word "Police" is written on it's on both sides.
In Doraemon: Nobita's Dinosaur, Black Mask's Time Machine was flat and had his face on it. It had an antenna and a chair. His time hole was rectangular shaped. In Doraemon: Nobita's Dinosaur 2006, his Time Machine was highly advanced and was more comfortable with fewer controls. It was big and wide and was designed like a king's seat. His time hope was hexagonal.
appears_in: Doraemon: Nobita and the Steel Troops
Doraemon Jumps Out of the Desk

jp_name: タイム・ルーム Taimu Rūmu
description: With the use of this gadget, a room will act as a time machine and the surroundings will change.
appears_in: The Story of the Old Persimmons

jp_name: 時限バカ弾 Jigen Baka Dan
description: The bomb has a timer that must be activated before it can detonate. If anything was caught in its area of effect, the bomb stupefies its targets, causing them to hallucinate and behave erratically.It affects both humans and machines, while the effect lasts for up to 5 minutes.

jp_name: トビレットペパー "Tobirettopēpā"
description: If you want to go picnic with carrying lot of stuff inside your backpack. This gadget will help you feel more lighter. Just put this thing inside your backpack and you wont get tired, even your going to hiking on the highest mountain. This gadget also allows users to fly by wrapping it around your shoulders and arm,

jp_name: 観光ビジョン ""Kankō bijon""
description:
Tourism Vision or Sightseeing Vision, Is a one of Doraemon gadgets. 
In order to help Nobita to finish his homework because the weather is hot outside. Doraemon take out the Toursim Vision from his pocket. This gadget allows you to change the background or scenery from your room, just select the place you want by adjusting the button and rotate the wheel. Only the scenery changed, but the wide of the room is still same as usual.
appears_in: I Can't Study in the Sahara Desert

jp_name: 列車用すごろくセット Ressha-yō sugoroku setto
description: First the four players must be on the train. The gameplay is the same as Sugoroku except that there are some changes. When a player draws a card, the player must wear the costume stated in the card. To remove the costumes, the train station must be the same as the Japanese character given. For example, Doraemon's card stated that "Go to station O to ponpokorin", if the train passes to the station Okanoue station, Doraemon's costume will be removed.
appears_in: Nobita Express and the Mystery of the Train Hunter

jp_name: まあまあ 棒 Ma Ma Bō
description: User attaches the stick to the target's mouth and says "まあ まあ! (Calm Down! Calm Down!)" and then target calms down. This gadget hides the target's anger inside of his/her body. The target's anger gets stuck inside his/her body and it grows little by little, then it explodes like a volcanic eruption if the user used the gadget too many times on a person.

jp_name: 変身ドリンク Henshin Dorinku
description:
The user must drink the Transformation drink and think of an animal or object he/she wants to transform. If the user has lack of focus, the transformation will consume negative effects. Effect ends after 6 hours.
In an episode called Shizuka Disappeared?!, it introduces the more upgraded version, the Transformation Drink EX (変身ドリンク・ＥＸ Henshin Dorinku Īekkusu) which is can transform a user into he/she desires instantly. After 6 hours, the transformation will be permanent, unlike the original one.
appears_in: The New Nobita's Great Demon ~Peko and the Exploration Party of 5~
Doraemon: New Nobita's Great Demon ~Peko and the Exploration Party of 5~

jp_name: 変身カチューシャ Henshin Kachūsha
description: The gadget gives the wearer girly hairstyle, skirt, pink-cheek, lipstick and long eyelashes. If the wearer tells their fake name while wearing it, the other people know the user with that name. It also hypnotizes people around them into believing the wearer is a girl.

jp_name: ほんやくコンニャク Hon'yaku kon'nyaku
description: If one eats it, the user will be able to speak and understand other languages, has the external effect of the user sounding fluent in the other languages. This edible gadget can also be used to communicate with animals as well.
appears_in: Running Across Time! The Time Borrowing Race
Doraemon: Nobita's Legend of the Sun King

jp_name: 正直太郎 Shōjikitarō
description: The Truth Doll truthfully tells the thing a person is thinking in mind to others.

jp_name: 正直電波
description:
The Truth Transmitter (正直電波 Shoki denpa) is the gadget used and owned by Doraemon.
It uses to force a person to tell the truth with its soundwave.
appears_in: Nobita's the Night Before a Wedding

jp_name: テレビとリもち Terebi torimochi
description: This gadget is used to get things from the television. If a person wants something from the television, he or she can get it with the use of the birdlime. You can put the birdlime inside the television, so it comes out of the television with what you want.
appears_in: Calling for Anything in TV Adhesive
